CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Ann Rushak, student, Greenfield and Miss Betty Claramelia, student, Greenfield, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 21, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think students are learning as much under the modern methods of teaching in public schools than students did years ago under the 3 R's (the old teaching method)?" Miss Mary Ann Rushak's answer reads: "I don't think so.  The teachers seen to not teach as much as they did in the past and seemingly don't have as much interest.  Also, teachers were stricter in the past.  I think this was better."  Miss Betty Claramelia's answer reads: "I think there are more books and they are better.  And if the teachers don't teach the subjects right, the books are so good that you, yourself, can learn from them."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Mary Ann Rushak wearing knit sweater with light colored collar and dark corduroy jacket, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Betty Claramelia wearing corduroy jacket with hood, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
